events.text: UI variables (don't adjust these directly, use the relevant functions)

events.name: uiChosenID
events.comment: the actual UI component that is focused right now

children.text: when a UI button is created, set constant properties

actions.text: the original size is recorded, for when this button is not chosen and is idle
add the original size to the mouseover size (if you set it to 4 in properties, then it will be 4 more than the original size)

children.functionDescription: enables a group of UI components - this will run a ui update
disables a group of UI components - this will run a ui update
disables every UI component on the layout - runs a UI update

children.text: if this button is chosen, and wasn't before...
if this button is no longer chosen...
if not, set button to lower opacity

selects the currently chosen UI component

will call a function with the syntax ("select " & uiButton.id)
ex: Function "select mainPlay"
add this function to any event sheet to register when a button is selected

keep in mind that if you change a button's ID, you'll have to change the name of its function, too

children.functionDescription: selects the currently chosen UI component

actions.text: call function with js, so that any function name can be called at runtime

children.text: ui navigation, such as pressing right to move to the right option

functionParameters.name: direction
functionParameters.comment: either left, right, up, or down

children.text: if no UI component is currently chosen, then pick a default one
in case an override is present, skip all else and perform the override
find relevant override string from instance variables
if override is present, perform it
these vars track the position of the UI component that was chosen prior to navigating
find the lowest or highest x/y value to wrap around to, and use this var to find all instances on the same pos
next, find the new option to choose depending on the direction
if components exist in this direction, pick the closest of them
if none found, wrap around to UI on the other side of the screen
if components exist in this direction, pick the closest of them
if none found, wrap around to UI on the other side of the screen
if components exist in this direction, pick the closest of them
if none found, wrap around to UI on the other side of the screen
if components exist in this direction, pick the closest of them
if none found, wrap around to UI on the other side of the screen

children.functionDescription: pick the nearest UI component out of all instances that are passed to this

children.text: find a default option to choose - it always chooses the top left most option

children.functionDescription: find a default option to choose

children.text: record the position of the last object, to compare with next
the ID of the last object, to use after this loop
loop through every UI component and find which has the lowest coordinates
hide scissor elements if they are not on screen
how long you need to hold down an input in order to start the auto-scroll behavior
how often the input repeats when auto-scrolling

children.title: ui interaction gamepad
children.description: keep in mind that only gamepad 0 can navigate the UI
